results.purpose: Track HelloFresh Group's Accessibility-2025 Program compliance with European Accessibility Act (EAA) and WCAG 2.2 Level AA standards
key_data_points: Goal 1: Reduce 90% of important accessibility issues by June 28, 2025 (WEB) and Dec 31, 2025 (Mobile)
Goal 2: Establish accessibility standards for future product development
P1 issues: 90% resolution target for 11 WCAG rules (WEB) by Dec 31
P0 issues: 90% resolution target for 4 WCAG rules (React Native) by Dec 31

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.context: One of three brands requiring accessibility compliance

entities.name: GreenChef
entities.context: One of three brands requiring accessibility compliance

entities.name: Factor
entities.context: One of three brands requiring accessibility compliance

entities.name: Foundations Alliance
entities.context: Team driving the program and providing Zest Design System components

entities.name: European Accessibility Act (EAA)
entities.context: Regulatory mandate requiring WCAG 2.2 Level AA compliance

entities.name: Zest Design System
entities.context: Component library made EAA-compliant for iOS, Android, Web, and React Native

entities.name: Cypress
entities.context: Automated testing tool identifying accessibility issues

insights: Significant compliance gap exists: WEB at 33% vs 53% target, Mobile at 15% vs 20% target
Mobile compliance is notably lower than web across all metrics
Program involves company-wide collaboration across all CFA teams owning Front End TRE
Third-party accessibility audits have been completed for all three brands
Automated end-to-end UI testing infrastructure is in place for ongoing compliance tracking
Non-compliance risks include substantial fines and potential legal action from disability advocacy groups
Business opportunity identified: access to new customers with disposable income who were previously functionally excluded
Foundations Alliance has proactively created compliant components, but full compliance requires journey-level modifications by individual teams
Multiple communication channels established (#accessibility-program-25, team-specific channels) indicating cross-functional coordination
